Metadata: Oregon State University Extension Service, Sea Grant Program

Fish spoil quickly if you don't handle them properly from the moment you land them. Mishandle fresh fish, and you end up with softened flesh, a strong flavor, and a 'fishy' or sour odor. Handle fresh fish properly, and you will enjoy a delicate flavor, fine texture, and a pleasing or neutral odor. This pamphlet covers proper handling in order to preserve good eating quality. It addresses killing, bleeding, and gutting the fish, and chilling with ice.
